result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:06 pm - Defendant Noah R Salazar appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant, in person.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Noah R Salazar
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-19-2022)
Prior: 1017 Hawthorne St, Two Rivers, WI 54241
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 06-24-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and 1st degree reckless homicide.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with the immediate family of the victim and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
